qas.question: Where do most systems go to get the data they use to calculate local time?
What two specific points of data do systems need to figure out to get local time?
What's another name for the IANA database?

context: However, even if UTC is used internally, the systems still require information on time zones to correctly calculate local time where it is needed. Many systems in use today base their <a1_0>date/time<a1_0/> calculations from data derived from <a0_0>the IANA time zone database<a0_0/> also known as <a2_0>zoneinfo<a2_0/>.
